newsitem.title: INDIA: Two killed as police fire on Indian mob.
newsitem.headline: Two killed as police fire on Indian mob.

text.p: Two people were killed and three injured when police opened fire on Saturday to control a rioting mob in a southern Indian town, police said.

Six policemen were injured, one of them seriously, when they tried to control a mob that started throwing stones at shops and property in Mulbagal, 100 km (62 miles) from Bangalore, after hearing a rumour that a mosque was desacrated, police said.

Police first used batons to disperse the crowd in the town, which has a large Moslem population, and later detained 25 people when the mob regrouped and violence continued, said A.P.Durai, police chief of the state of Karnataka.
Protestors rioted to demand the release of the detained, which led to the police firing, Durai told Reuters in Bangalore, state capital of Karnataka.
Police imposed a curfew, Durai said. There was no confirmation of any act of desacration, police said.
